prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved side** The first part of the CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units long (x-axis), 2 units wide (y-axis), and 1 unit tall (z-axis). The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Begin a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with the following dimensions: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.6561, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.6561, 0.0) to (0.6561, 0.2109) - Line 3: (0.6561, 0.2109) to (0.6561, 0.6459) - Line 4: (0.6561, 0.6459) to (0.403, 0.6459) - Line 5: (0.403, 0.6459) to (0.403, 0.2109) - Line 6: (0.403, 0.2109) to (0.0, 0.2109) - Line 7: (0.0, 0.2109) to (0.0, 0.0) **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6561. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Define the transformation of the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis to a height of 0.1875 units in the positive direction and 0.1875 units in the negative direction, resulting in a final height of 0.6561 units. Set the sketch scaling factor to 0.6561. Perform a boolean operation to create a new solid body. The resulting shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.6561 units - Width: 0.375 units - Height: 0.6561 units</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.375,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.6561,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6561,0.0],"End Point":[0.6561,0.2109]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6561,0.2109],"End Point":[0.6561,0.6459]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.6561,0.6459],"End Point":[0.403,0.6459]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.403,0.6459],"End Point":[0.403,0.2109]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.403,0.2109],"End Point":[0.0,0.2109]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2109],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1875,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.1875,"sketch_scale":0.6561,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Triangular Top Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch Next, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. Step 3: Create Faces and Loops In the sketch, create six lines forming a closed shape consisting of a rectangle and a triangle. The lines should be defined as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.625] * Line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.625], End Point [0.25, 0.625] * Line 4: Start Point [0.25, 0.625], End Point [0.25, 0.25] * Line 5: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] * Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 4: Scale the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.625. Step 5: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction to a depth of 0.75 units to create the 3D model. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a triangular top. Dimensions: The length, width and height of the intermediate part (part_1) and final shape are as follows: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.625 units * Height: 0.625 units Continue with the next parts by following the same pattern, providing detailed instructions for each intermediate part based on the provided CAD Assembly JSON. Begin each part by stating the shape being constructed and avoid using specific boolean operation terms. Provide dimensions as necessary.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.625],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.25,0.25]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.25]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.625,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}

Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0031 - Sketch scale: 0.4392 - Operation: JoinFeatureOperation The dimensions of part 2 are approximately: - Length: 0.4392 units - Width: 0.0031 units - Height: 0.4392 units</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1:** A Rectangular Metal Plate with Evenly Spaced Holes **1.1 Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0082, 0.0] **1.2 Sketch** Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. **1.2.1 Face 1** Face 1 will be the main body of the rectangular metal plate and will contain four lines and three circles. **1.2.1.1 Loop 1: Rectangular Outline** Loop 1 is a rectangle formed by four lines. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1141, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1141, 0.0], End Point [0.1141, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1141, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **1.2.1.2 Loop 2, 3, and 4: Holes** Loops 2, 3, and 4 are circles located at specific positions on the X-axis and Y-axis. - Circle 1: Center [0.0571, 0.0815], Radius 0.0122 - Circle 2: Center [0.0571, 0.375], Radius 0.0122 - Circle 3: Center [0.0571, 0.6685], Radius 0.0122 **1.3 Extrusion** Perform a 0.0082-unit deep extrusion along the normal vector and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. The operation for the extrusion is to create a new solid body for the current part. **1.4 Dimensions** The length of the part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.0082 units, and the height is 0.75 units. The rectangular metal plate has three equally spaced holes along one edge.</description>
